title: Gaura Mandala Parikrama 2024 | Srila Raghunatha Dasa Gosvami: His Pastimes and Legacy
speaker: HDG Srila Prabhupada

segments.text: So, this is the birthplace of Dasaragunath.
Who was very much connected to the Paani Hatti festival.
And one of the six Goswamis, Rupa Raghunathpade.
So this Raghunath.
This is the birthplace of Raghunath Goswami.
We all know that he was born in a very very rich family.
Big Jamindar's family.
So this must have been a big big palatial bungalow with lot of things.
Yes.
Daytime you could see the ruins, lot of ruins are there in this site.
Sri Raghunath Das Goswami, one of the six revered Goswamis of Vrindavan was born in
Krishnapur located in Bandel.
So this is Bandel area.
One of the seven villages comprising Saptak Gram.
Srila Raghunath Das Goswami's intense devotion attracted the special mercy of Sri Radha and
Krishna.
Who appeared to protect him from tigers at Radha Kund and provided shade during hot days
while he chanted his rounds.
Srila Raghunath Das, the combined incarnation of the potencies of Hrithi Manjari and Rasa
Manjari and Bhanumati Devi was born into a wealthy Vaishnava family in Krishnapur.
He received guidance from stalwart Vaishnavas like Sri Yedunanda and Sri Krishna.
He was also the father of a very rich family.
He was also the father of a very rich family.
In his childhood True Bharat Lauream Lord Yudhuvu Sri Raja of Kriya replied by saying
that Sri Yudhunanda Acharya and Balaramacharya were types of
herzlich worshipped.
Despite repeated attempts to leave home for Jagannath Puri to accompany the Lord, he was sent back.
Chaitanya Mahaprabhu advised him against false renunciation, Markata Vairagya,
urging him to engage in befitting renunciation, Yukta Vairagya.
Raghunath Das married as per his parents' wish but remained internally devoted to Lord Chaitanya.
Raghunath Das harbored a deep longing to reunite with Lord Gauranga.
Ceasing an opportunity to escape, he fled to Puri, surrendering to Lord Chaitanya.
In Puri, he exhibited exemplary renunciation, pleasing Mahaprabhu who gifted him Govardhanashila and Gunjamala.
Raghunath Das' life of austerity and devotion remains eternal.
He is an enduring source of inspiration, epitomizing the essence of surrender and devotion to the Lord.
While most cannot imitate his extreme renunciation,
his example encourages seekers to cultivate deeper spiritual dedication and humility in their own lives.
